name: Atlas
description: The Atlas is the oldest Titan model on the Frontier and has instigated the development of both the Stryder and Ogre patterns. It was used through the Titan Wars, and onto the Frontier War where the Titanfall games take place.[1] The Atlas is equipped with a Damage Core, which, when ready, the pilot can activate on command to substantially increase damage dealt by the titan.

traits.name: Chamelion Systems
traits.description: ATLAS has a unique OS that allows their system to be used with any of IMCs other equipment from other MK1 frames. (As long as it has the right hardpoints)

traits.name: Ion Coating
traits.description: ATLAS has a resistance to energy damage.

traits.name: Custom Venting
traits.description: ATLAS passivly reduces 1 heat at the begining of its activation.

synergies.detail: ATLAS passivly reduces 1 heat at the begining of its activation.

core_system.name: Power Drive
core_system.description: Damage Core is a special core ability for the ATLAS Titan. When activated, after 2.5 seconds it will allow players to dash as much as possible for 12.6 seconds, 17.892 seconds with Core Extender, and instantly starts your Titan's shield recharge.
core_system.active_effect: Upon core activation the ATLAS gains doubles all damage until the turn timer runs out (Though you may deactivate it earlier). Each round the damage core is active it reduces the counter down by 1 and regains 1 point for every round deactivated.

name: Stryder
description: The Stryder is a Titan chassis developed and manufactured by Hammond Robotics. Developed as an extremely mobile and maneuverable Titan variant, the Stryder's almost skeletal design has been optimized for superior speed and agility. Significant improvements have been made to its Dash Core, enabling it to use it more frequently, while the Titan can also sprint for greater distances, making it perfect for hit-and-run attacks, ambushes and rapid redeployments. Unfortunately, this speed comes at a price. The Stryder's design is stripped down compared to other Titan variants, and its armor is largely non-existent, making it much more fragile in combat. In Titan-vs-Titan engagements, Stryder Pilots must use all available cover and their machine's impressive speed to outflank and evade their heavier adversaries, as they are unlikely to survive a straight-up slugfest.

traits.name: Thin Frame
traits.description: If you move during your turn your armor is equal to 3 until the start of your next turn.

traits.name: [REACTION] Dash Capacitor (3 Turn Cooldown)
traits.description: Stryder gains a recharging dash that can allows the titan to move 1 hex in any direction. Should your reaction be triggered by an attack, STRYDERs pilot will be required to make an agility save. Dash Capacitor requires 3 turns cooldown after use.

traits.name: Gel Joints
traits.description: Styder has -1 Difficulty on Agility checks and saves.

synergies.detail: The Stryder gains +1 on Agility checks and saves.

core_system.name: Overdrive Subsystems
core_system.description: Dash Core is a special core ability for the Stryder Titan. When activated, after 2.5 seconds it will allow players to dash as much as possible for 12.6 seconds, 17.892 seconds with Core Extender, and instantly starts your Titan's shield recharge.
core_system.active_effect:
Upon activation the Stryder gains the folowing Effects until the end of its next turn:
- Stryder gains +2 to Agility checks and Saves
- Stryder gains max movement equal to its dash.
- Upon ending its turn complete the 'Stabilize' full action.

name: Ogre
description: The H-KA02/a Ogre Heavy Titan is a Titan model produced by Hammond Armament Division and Wonyeon Defense. Developed as an extremely tough Titan chassis, the Ogre's design has been compared to a main battle tank, optimized for taking higher amounts of damage and dealing out more than the Atlas or Stryder Titans. The Ogre stands slightly taller than the Atlas and has bulkier armor. The main entry point of an Ogre is via a large hatch on its top rather than the chest, like the Atlas or Stryder. The Ogre is equipped with a Shield Core, which amps the Titan's shield for a limited time.

traits.name: ITS A WALKING FRIDGE
traits.description: OGRE can be used for hard cover by adjacent allied characters. OGRE also counts as one size above for the purpose of interactions.

traits.name: Heavy Frame
traits.description: OGRE cannot be knocked back, pushed, pulled, or be knocked prone by actors smaller than itself.

traits.name: Slow
traits.description: OGRE gets +1 Difficulty on agility checks and saves.

synergies.detail: OGRE gains +1 Difficulty on Agility checks and saves.

core_system.name: Shield Core
core_system.description: Lifes good, I like living, so whats better than a literal shield wall that blocks projectiles from hitting you while still being able to fire back.
core_system.active_effect: Drop a lightwall barrier at your feet. It has 10hp and blocks all incoming projectiles as if it is hard cover. Once placed the Hardwall cannot be moved unless picked up and repositioned.

deployables.name: Hardwall
deployables.detail: Drop a wall at your Feet that wraps one hex to the left and right around where your mech is located.

name: Bison
description: The KA-BI50N was originally a mining mech from Kodai Mining Industries (A subsidiary of the IMC) though after the destruction of Demeter many workers defected to the Militia bringing their modified Ogre frames with them. The Bison represents some of the Militias best ingenuity at work, combining what they learnt from the Vanguard with IMC technology. At this point in time there are very limited Bison in use due to the limited production of Kodai Mining varients of Ogre Frames but they still see very active use in some post Typhon battles.

traits.name: Sub-Frame
traits.description:
BISON is a subframe of the OGRE titan. Please double check in with your DM/GM before using this titan if they will allow you to use it.
Recommended Case: GM requires you to have 2LL in OGRE!

traits.name: Juggernaut Type
traits.description: If the BISON is moving then you may add +3 to agility Saves and +6 to your agility. You may also add +1 to your speed for every turn spent in motion. (Resets after stopping)

synergies.detail: BISON gains +3 on Agility checks and saves if the titan has moved this turn.

traits.name: Heavy Frame
traits.description: Bison cannot be knocked back, pushed, pulled, or be knocked prone by actors smaller than itself.

traits.name: Bulk Up
traits.description: Bison Deploys a dome shield that extends for 4 tiles from the center. While inside the bubble all damage is reduced by 1d6+Structure.

core_system.name: Beserker Core
core_system.description: D&D moment. When your beserker rages even the fires of hell turn up to watch the chaos that will ensue.
core_system.active_effect:
Bison gains the following effects from Beserker Core:
  • +1 Speed
  • All attacks now gain 1d6 burn damage.
  • All weapons with the loading tag are ignored while beserker core is enabled.
